answers.answer: Hi,Chronic white matter ischemic disease usually refers to lack of blood deep in the brain and presents with  white spots in the brain parenchyma or white matter. Problems with the blood vessels can arise from underlying conditions such as hypertension, diabetes, hyperlipidemia or autoimmune diseases. It is best that you talk to your neurologist about this for proper evaluation and management. It is also recommended that underlying medical conditions be managed as well. Take care and regards.

question: Is there any medications for chronic ischemic white matter disease? My doctor is telling that there isn't? Is this true?
title: Chronic Ischemic white matter disease
